intro: Crepidorhopalon goetzei, commonly known as the Goetze's crepidorhopalon, is a rare and specialized plant species belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered umbels of white to pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forest floors or rocky crevices. Its leaves are finely divided and have a distinctive, aromatic scent. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
